sentences.english: If they are dead, they ought to be buried.
sentences.chinese: 如果它們已經死了，那就得被埋葬。

sentences.english: Do with their death bury their parents' strife.
sentences.chinese: 著實以兩人的死埋葬雙方父母的鬥爭。

sentences.english: Bury the creature if you lose control of Seraph.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不再操控六翼天使，則埋葬此生物。

sentences.english: From the Yongle Emperor onwards, 13 Ming Dynasty Emperors were buried in this area.
sentences.chinese: 自永樂帝開始，明朝十三陵共埋葬了十三位皇帝。

sentences.english: Devout men buried Stephen and made great lamentation over him.
sentences.chinese: 有虔誠的人把司提反埋葬了，爲他捶胸大哭。

sentences.english: Should divine life be immured in the charnel house of fleshly lust?
sentences.chinese: 聖潔的生活應該埋葬在肉體情慾的墳墓內嗎？

sentences.english: His remains were shipped back and laid away in a cemetery.
sentences.chinese: 他的遺體被運回，埋葬在一個公墓裏。

sentences.english: The institutions, precepts, and rites of the Freemasons.
sentences.chinese: 爲死亡或埋葬而進行的儀式。

sentences.english: It is true, nevertheless, that grave- diggers do die themselves.
sentences.chinese: 那卻是事實，埋葬工人一樣會死。

sentences.english: Ashes of the corpse that stands, an unburied death.
sentences.chinese: 是站起來的屍灰，是未埋葬的死。

sentences.english: All that mattered was that they had a body to bury and perform prayers upon.
sentences.chinese: 重要的是，他們有一具屍體可以埋葬併爲之禱告。

sentences.english: He was buried on a hillside outside Nanjing, not far from Sun Yat-sen’s mausoleum.
sentences.chinese: 他被埋葬在南京郊外的一個小山丘邊，離中山陵不遠。

sentences.english: Seán helped Bridget bury the mayor in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 肖恩幫助布里奇特埋葬市長在花園裏。

sentences.english: If it is not buried again forthwith, the consequences will be dire.
sentences.chinese: 如果不再把它立即埋葬，後果將是可怕的。

sentences.english: With the emergency of Foucault's post-modern philosophy, traditional philosophy was buried thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 而後現代福柯的出現，則徹底埋葬了傳統哲學。

sentences.english: They buried the corpse in the churchyard.
sentences.chinese: 他們在教堂墓地裏把死者埋葬了。

definition: grave/tomb/graveyard/cemetery/fig. one's native place (where one's ancestors are buried)
